intro: Corispermum algidum, commonly known as the Arctic bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It is a small, herbaceous annual that thrives in nutrient-poor, cold environments. The plant has small, green, fleshy leaves that store water, and it produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. Its adaptations to extreme climates make it an important component of polar ecosystems.
